short_description: Contributed to the development of the website for the GeoMundus Conference 2023, held in Castellón, Spain, with a focus on responsive design, UX/UI design, performance optimization, debugging, and effective team collaboration.
long_description: As part of the web team for the GeoMundus Conference 2023, I contributed to the development of the official website with a strong focus on front-end development. My responsibilities included building a responsive and semantic HTML structure, styling with CSS, SCSS, and SASS, and ensuring cross-browser compatibility. I optimized website performance by minimizing resources, optimizing images, and implementing lazy loading techniques. I prioritized user experience by designing intuitive navigation and accessible, user-friendly interfaces. I also handled debugging using Chrome Developer Tools and maintained high code quality through linting tools like Stylelint and Prettier in VS Code. Collaboration and project management were key aspects of my role, using Git for version control and Trello for task tracking, workflow planning, and team communication.

company_name: Geological Survey & Mines Bureau, Colombo, Sri Lanka.
short_description: Conducted geospatial analysis, automated ETL workflows, and geodatabase management using SQL, GIS, and remote sensing tools. Designed interactive maps, performed risk assessments, and automated data processes to support mining and environmental projects while ensuring regulatory compliance.
long_description: In my role, I automated end-to-end workflows for file and application movement and maintained the mining site geodatabase using PostgreSQL and PostGIS, leveraging spatial queries and dashboards to improve efficiency by 90%. I collected geospatial data from UAVs, GPS surveys, ArcGIS field tools, and Google Earth across 250+ mining sites, processing datasets through ETL pipelines into geodatabases. I automated the conversion of geospatial data into KML, KMZ, JSON, GeoJSON, Shapefile, and CSV formats, while filling null fields to enhance data accuracy and reduce manual processing time by 70%. Additionally, I integrated remote sensing data with GIS workflows to monitor land-use changes and detect illegal mining activities. I conducted spatial analyses, including hotspot analysis and kernel density estimation using ArcGIS and QGIS, developing maps and dashboards to identify mining hotspots, determine optimal exploration areas, and support risk assessment.

company_name: GSMB Technical Services (PVT) LTD., Colombo, Sri Lanka.
short_description: Led GIS and spatial analysis for the Southern Expressway Extension Project (ESEP3), building  geodatabases, automating workflows with Python, and integrating drone/GPS data to support mapping, reporting, and project decisions.
long_description: As a GIS Analyst on the Southern Expressway Extension Project (ESEP3) in Hambantota, part of the Main Highway construction, I supported geospatial analysis and mapping throughout the project. I developed spatial databases in PostgreSQL/PostGIS, incorporating highway chainages, nearby structures, construction details, and land-use data, and performed spatial queries and visualizations to support decision-making. Using ArcMap and QGIS, I conducted spatial analyses on large-scale Earth Observation datasets, including land use classification, buffer zone calculations, utility mapping, and network analysis. I enhanced site data collection with drone surveys and integrated GPS survey data into GIS platforms. To improve efficiency, I automated geoprocessing workflows using Python and SQL scripts for data cleaning, feature extraction, and report generation. Project progress was tracked using MS Project, and I collaborated with engineers and managers to define requirements, ensure accuracy, and deliver timely reports. Additionally, I analyzed large datasets using spreadsheets, applying pivot tables and visualizations to extract actionable insights.
